Yoga and Meditation: In the absence of sporting equipment, one can turn to yoga and meditation as a way to stay active and fit. Yoga involves stretching and strengthening exercises that can be done without any equipment, and meditation can help with mental and physical well-being.
Hiking and Exploring: Hiking is a great way to stay active and fit, and it's also a great way to explore the outdoors. Hiking involves walking on rough terrain and can be done without any equipment.
Swimming: Swimming is a great way to stay active and fit, and it's also a low-impact exercise that's easy on the joints. Swimming can be done in a pool or in the open water.
Dancing: Dancing is a fun and engaging way to stay active and fit. Dancing can be done with or without music and can be done alone or with others.
Cycling: Cycling is a great way to stay active and fit, and it's also a low-impact exercise that's easy on the joints. Cycling can be done on a stationary bike or on a road bike.
